com.pholser.junit.quickcheck.generator

Class Ctor<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pholser.junit.quickcheck.generator.Generator<T>
      • com.pholser.junit.quickcheck.generator.Ctor<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of objects generated
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Shrink<T>
    Deprecated. 
    This was introduced to alleviate the difficulties of old Theory methods with many parameters, and will likely go away.

    @Deprecated
public class Ctor<T>
extends Generator<T>

    Produces instances of a class by reflecting the class for a single accessible constructor, generating values for the constructor's parameters, and invoking the constructor.

    If a constructor parameter is marked with an annotation that influences the generation of a given kind of value, it will be applied to the generation of values for that parameter.

    This generator is intended to be used with From, and not to be available via the ServiceLoader mechanism.

    • Method Detail

      • generate

        public T generate(SourceOfRandomness random,
                  GenerationStatus status)
        Deprecated. 
        Description copied from class: Generator

        Produces a value for a property parameter.

        A generator may raise an unchecked exception if some condition exists which would lead to a confusing generation -- for example, if a generator honored a "range" configuration, and the endpoints were transposed.

        Specified by:
        generate in class Generator<T>
        Parameters:
        random - source of randomness to be used when generating the value
        status - an object that the generator can use to influence the value it produces. For example, a generator for lists can use the size method to generate lists with a given number of elements.
        Returns:
        the generated value

      • canRegisterAsType

        Overrides:

        Returns:

      • configure

        public void configure(AnnotatedType annotatedType)
        Deprecated. 
        Description copied from class: Generator

        Configures this generator using annotations from a given annotated type.

        This method considers only annotations that are themselves marked with GeneratorConfiguration.

        By default, the generator will configure itself using this procedure:

        • For each of the given annotations:
          • Find a public method on the generator named configure, that accepts a single parameter of the annotation type
          • Invoke the configure method reflectively, passing the annotation as the argument
        Overrides:
        configure in class Generator<T>
        Parameters:
        annotatedType - a type usage
